intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. castellana, commonly known as the Castellana bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that contribute to its ornamental value in gardens.
